review_title: Onondaga community college is a great place to work if you like a great faculty and colleagues and students.
pros: The faculty, staff and students are fantastic at OCC.
cons: the pay is about the same as all the other colleges in the area. not necessarily a con but something to point out. don't really have anything bad to say about Onondaga community college.

pros: The college has a lot of rebuilding to do after the previous administration created a very difficult atmosphere. There is a new administration and hopefully that will allow the college to create a healthier and less stressful work environment. Faculty are super student focused.
cons: rebuilding needs to be done after the previous administration created a very hostile environment.

review_title: Serious Administrative Bloat, Weak "Union", Stay Away
pros: Claims to pay adjuncts more than any other community college in the state. Claims to be pro-diversity.
cons: No benefits, advancement, or support from the union, and enrollment is always down. Talking to a larger, more powerful union is grounds for termination. Bullying from full-time faculty is the norm, and complaints are ignored mainly. Actual diversity efforts are lip service at best and are anti-LGBTQ+. You won't be fired, just given less classes with pressure to quit.

pros: the people and time off
cons: I do not have any cons

job_title: Residence Hall Director in Syracuse, NY
pros: It’s a really beautiful campus
cons: Some of the students really don’t want to be here for an education

pros: There are many friendly people working here.
cons: This is a primarily white institution with very little diversity in their workforce.

pros: flexible hours stress less work
cons: i do not have much to say

pros: Everything is great wonderful place to work
cons: No complaints this place is awsome to work

pros: Smaller school, Great people to work with
cons: Higher Ed can be stressful

pros: Attractive campus. The students are generally great. The support staff is helpful and cheerful. Most of the faculty/adjuncts are highly qualified, and want to help students.
cons: The current administration is so focused on the bottom line, they're making decisions that are detrimental to students and the community; for example: cutting staff positions, leaving faculty without staff support, and replacing full time faculty with adjuncts.

pros: Easy, weekly pay, calm atmosphere, diverse
cons: Understaffed, not many cons I wasn’t there for too long

job_title: Senior Business Advisor in Syracuse, NY
pros: Beautiful campus, unionized, and pretty decent benefits package.
cons: Micromanagement, a "culture of no", low employee morale.

review_title: I don't review where I currently work because that is dumb
pros: Job with pay check daily
cons: Job with working hours daily

review_title: Good School, great job, not so great experience with Lab Manager
job_title: IT Lab Technician in Syracuse, NY
pros: The study time is great!
cons: Management makes unprofessional remarks, makes other uncomfortable

pros: overall great, good experience working
cons: Cant think of any at the moment

pros: Helpful, fast assistant, good handling..etc
cons: I didn’t see a lot of cons in it , but the only cons was in there is the place was a little old.

pros: The work environment is challenging and ever changing.
cons: Lack of job security at OCC.

job_title: Account Clerk II in Syracuse, NY
pros: Love the people that I work with!
cons: Nothing that I can think of currently.

pros: NYS benefits; including good health care plan; good amount of paid leave each year.
cons: Very low pay compared to similar jobs at other central NY colleges & universities; "secretive," disenchanting, disheartening culture of fear and insecurity; opportunities for involvement in efforts that could lead to advancement or meaningful recognition seem to be repeatedly reserved for the same invited/chosen few, despite high expectation for countless other staff to contribute to and participate in other numerous campus-wide efforts needed throughout the year to adequately serve students and families during important campus or "campus community" events, such as move-in day, "party on the quad," open house, etc; ...events for which staff will engage fully in, but that go largely unseen.

review_title: Drastic changes have negative impact on review
pros: Work at Onondaga provides ongoing opportunities to help others, to encourage development of students, and to witness their personal growth. Good pay,  benefits.
cons: Wholesale changes in leadership and seeming disregard for employees, and recognition of impact on students.  Reduction in benefits packages, starting salaries not keeping up with cost of living increases.  Dedicated staff.

pros: Easy to get classes to teach. Pretty easy commute if you live in the city of Syracuse.
cons: Bad winters. Severe lack of preparation when you're first hired. This school feels like a dumping ground for students who can't afford another school or who have had academic trouble, and it's definitely not the students' fault. I hardly got to know anyone in my department because most teachers just come to teach their classes and then they leave. There's no real sense of community. They wait until the last minute to do everything. It'll be August and they'll call you to beg you to teach more classes. This place needs a clean sweep of the administration, and this is exactly why I don't work here anymore. There is no room to improve or to change your position.

pros: The students are the reason you go to work everyday.
cons: Prior to the leadership of Dr. Casey Crabill OCC was a wonderful place to work.  People were kind to one another and you were provided the support necessary to be successful in your work.  Dr. Crabill has fostered and brought in leadership that create a toxic work environment.  If you have an opinion that is opposite of theirs in anyway you can expect to be managed out the door.  They do not have the best interest of students and are putting students at future financial risk with the things they are allowing all for increased revenue on their end.

pros: Mostly dedicated faculty and staff.  Really makes a difference in the lives of students who want an education.
cons: Many students don't really want to be in school, and it can be frustrating.  Administration is being taken over by bean-counters who care more about dollars than education.

review_title: It was like coming home after I attended classes and later returned to teach.
pros: Friendly atmosphere. Great diversity in students, age, race, religion, backgrounds. The staff and faculty really care about the students and are invested in helping them learn and grow.
cons: Too many adjunct positions. Not hiring for full-time employment on a regular basis.

pros: Wonderful to get to work with the students and have an impact on their life.  Salary is fair, despite the fact that the share of benefits is ever increasing.
cons: Dr. Crabill and the Executive Council have no concern for the staff of the college.  They lack communication skills and are reckless in their decisions.  The staff are all afraid they will be the next one let go.

pros: Excellent work-life balance, vibrant community, interesting people to work with, student population diverse and exciting
cons: Union issues as an adjunct.  Not much support from union as adjunct. Difficutly to move into full time faculty position.

pros: Autonomy,  good support from Chairs, great campus, good facilities, really caring faculty
cons: Politics, adjuncts are treated as lesser, adjunct positions are disappearing

pros: Once instructors pass  probationary status of eight semesters, they are free to choose their own curriculum.
cons: No health insurance for contingent employees

review_title: The culture has changed that it is no longer a good place to work.
pros: The job duties were diverse never boring.
cons: Managers were untrained in the field.

pros: You have to be working hard and tobe patient with cutomers, friendly with people.
cons: Don't be mad or quit a job with no reason.

pros: great atmosphere, small class size
cons: last minute assignments to classes

pros: Free, easy parking and nice-looking campus
cons: Salaried staff are mandated to work extra hours (weekends and weekdays) throughout the summer with NO comp-time. Top management works those extra hours as well - but they make sure they get time off.

job_title: Can’t Say But Bad Department in Syracuse, NY
pros: Students and free tuition if you are full time
cons: HR/ Management is terrible very top heavy
